title: ‘Vision or Mirage’ Review: Finding the Key to the Kingdom
sub_head: With a nuanced policy, American ofﬁcials can encourage reform in Saudi Arabia without supporting its authoritarian tendencies.
body:
Oxford University has produced some of the world’s most illustrious scholars of Arabia, including Sir Richard Burton, Gertrude Bell and T.E. Lawrence, the famous Lawrence of Arabia. More recently, a young Oxford graduate, David Rundell, landed in Saudi Arabia in 1981 and began a nearly 40-year career as a U.S. diplomat there. Steeped in Islamic history and Arabic literature, and fluent in the language, he visited every corner of the kingdom, talking with tribesmen, businessmen, clerics and kings while panning for knowledge like a California miner for gold.
